title: Art and Music Education in Schools

question.text: Some people believe art and music should be compulsory subjects in schools, while others think academic subjects like science and mathematics are more important. Discuss both views and give your opinion.

questionType.explanation: You must discuss BOTH perspectives equally (arts should be compulsory AND academic subjects are more important) and clearly state your own opinion.
requirements: Discuss why art and music should be compulsory
Discuss why academic subjects are more important
Provide specific examples for each view

structure.introduction: While some believe [View A], others argue that [View B]. In my opinion, [Your clear position].
structure.body1: On the one hand, [Topic sentence supporting View A]. This is because [Reason/explanation]. For instance, [Specific example]. As a result, [Consequence or benefit].
structure.body2: On the other hand, [Topic sentence supporting View B]. The main reason is [Reason/explanation]. For example, [Specific example]. Therefore, [Conclusion about this view].
structure.conclusion: In conclusion, while [Brief summary of both views], I believe [Restate your position with final thought].

example.introduction: While some believe art and music are essential for holistic education, others argue that academic subjects provide more practical benefits. In my opinion, schools should balance both to develop well-rounded students.
example.body1: On the one hand, mandatory arts education provides crucial developmental benefits. This is because engagement with music and art enables students to develop emotional intelligence and creativity. For instance, research shows that musical training enhances spatial reasoning and problem-solving abilities. As a result, students exposed to arts demonstrate improved confidence and communication skills.
example.body2: On the other hand, prioritizing academic subjects offers tangible career advantages. The main reason is that mathematical and scientific proficiency leads to greater access to high-paying technical careers. For example, most positions in engineering, medicine, and technology require strong STEM foundations. Therefore, emphasis on core academics strengthens students' economic opportunities.
example.conclusion: In conclusion, while both artistic and academic education have distinct merits, I believe schools should integrate both to prepare students for comprehensive personal and professional success.

modelEssay.text:
Educators hold divergent views regarding curriculum priorities in schools. While some advocate making art and music compulsory, others contend that academic subjects like mathematics and science deserve greater emphasis. In my view, schools should balance both creative and analytical disciplines to cultivate well-rounded students.

On the one hand, mandatory arts education provides crucial developmental benefits beyond academic achievement. Engagement with music and visual arts enables students to develop emotional intelligence, creative thinking, and self-expression capabilities that traditional academics cannot fully address. Specifically, research in neuroscience demonstrates that musical training enhances spatial reasoning, pattern recognition, and memory functions. Furthermore, students participating in regular arts programs exhibit improved empathy, self-confidence, and communication abilities. Consequently, comprehensive arts instruction contributes to holistic child development essential for personal fulfillment.

On the other hand, prioritizing core academic subjects offers tangible advantages for career success in competitive economies. Mathematical and scientific proficiency provides foundational skills that lead to greater access to high-paying technical careers. For example, most positions in engineering, medicine, and technology sectors require strong STEM backgrounds, and data shows graduates with these qualifications earn significantly higher salaries than those with arts-focused education. Moreover, countries such as Singapore and South Korea consistently rank highest in global competitiveness by emphasizing mathematics and science. Therefore, academic emphasis strengthens students' economic opportunities and national productivity.

In conclusion, while arts education develops creativity and emotional capabilities, and academic subjects provide practical career competencies, I believe educational institutions should integrate both disciplines. Ultimately, balanced curricula prepare students for comprehensive personal and professional success in modern society.
